meanings.definition: To be repeated several times as an echo.
meanings.sent1: Her laughter reverberated through the empty hallway.
meanings.sent2: The sound of the bell reverberated in the quiet church.
meanings.sent3: The joke he told reverberated around the room, making everyone chuckle.
meanings.sent4: His powerful speech reverberated in the hearts of the audience long after he finished.
meanings.sent5: The thunder reverberated through the valley, shaking the ground beneath their feet.

meanings.definition: To have a prolonged effect or impact.
meanings.sent1: The kind words she said to him reverberated in his mind for days.
meanings.sent2: The decision to cut down the trees will reverberate throughout the entire forest.
meanings.sent3: His apology reverberated in her heart, slowly melting away her anger.
meanings.sent4: The news of the victory reverberated across the nation, bringing joy to all.
meanings.sent5: The consequences of his actions reverberated through his life, changing everything in its path.

meanings.sent1: The music reverberated off the walls of the concert hall.
meanings.sent2: His voice reverberated in the vast cave, creating an eerie effect.
meanings.sent3: The sound of the waves reverberated in her ears, lulling her to sleep.
meanings.sent4: The cheers of the crowd reverberated in the stadium, creating an electrifying atmosphere.
meanings.sent5: The gunshot reverberated in the silent night, causing everyone to freeze in fear.
